content.description:
MAP OF THE SOUTH WALES COALFIELD, A MAJOR MINING CENTER IN GREAT BRITAIN, CIRCA 1820

Tramroads were iron rail tracks that used horse-drawn wagons to carry loads of coal from the mines to the ports at Cardiff and Newport.
content.question: Together with access to coal deposits, which environmental factor most directly contributed to Great Britainâ€™s early industrialization?

choices.label: Its location on an island group separate from continental Europe
Its cold climate, unsuitable for cultivating many crops
Its plentiful domestic sources of gold and silver
